description:
T4 1600 Oak- Remove dead wood, height reduction of 2m to reduce the load on the tight fork. Laterally reduce over highway by 2m. T5 1507 Oak - Crown lift to 2.5m over pavement. T8 Sweet Chestnut - Remove two lowest branches to allow more light to bed below.T10 1598 Robinia - Remove Holm Oak and cut back from the BT wires by 1m. Remove dead wood. Laterally reduce over highway by 2m. T11 1506 Oak  - Remove dead wood and crossing branches. T12 1569 Chestnut - Remove lower stem growth. Clear telegraph pole and BT wires by 1m.
 T13 1595 Sycamore - Climbing inspection for early signs of Sooty Bark Disease. Remove basal growth. Laterally reduce over highway by 2m. T14 1566 Holly - Crown lift to 3m over pavement. T15 1520 Laburnum - Crown lift to 3m over pavement. T16 Holly - Crown lift to 3m over pavement.
 T18 1550 Chestnut - Crown lift to 3m over pavement and 5.5m over highway. T19 Holly - Crown lift to 3m over pavement. T20 1596 Robinia - Crown lift to 3m over pavement and 5.5m over highway. Remove dead wood. Climbing inspection of cavities and overall structural integrity. T21 1558 Robinia - Crown lift to 3m over pavement. T22 1559 Robinia - Remove low basal stem. Trim back to clear railings by 1m. T27 1585 Lime - Remove basal growth. T37 1586 Holm Oak  - Crown lift to 2m.
T43 1533 Ash - Remove dead wood over 50mm. Clear telegraph pole and BT wires by 1m. Inspect for Ash die-back. T46 1502 Holly - Crown lift to 2.5m over pavement.
 1T55 1590 Sycamore - Remove dead wood over 50mm. Laterally reduce over highway by 2m. T56 1522 Cherry -  Crown lift to 2.5m removing sub laterals only. T58 1534 Sycamore -Remove basal and lower stem growth to 4m. Check large stem wounds for cavities. Laterally reduce over highway by 2m. T59 1557 Robinia - Remove dead wood over 50mm. Crown lift to 2m. Remove crossing branches. Laterally reduce over highway by 2m. T60 1543 Robinia - Remove Ivy to ground level. T62 1556 Laburnum  - Remove two self-sown Ash saplings. application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
